creator: coolfire@insomnia247.nl
text:
The ordering of index files cannot be overwritten in the httpd.conf

The default httpd.conf includes
DirectoryIndex index.html

If I try to overwrite this to prioritize .php over .html at a later point in the httpd.conf or any included conf files it does not work and the original setting in httpd.conf is still used.

Tested on:
2.2.22 (Debian 7)
2.4.6  (CentOS 7)
2.4.10 (Debian 8)
2.4.12 (Built from source on Debian 8)


Since we only manage a custom file that is included to avoid meddling with package manager maintained files we'd prefer not to change httpd.conf itself.

Have you tried what is described in 
   http://httpd.apache.org/docs/current/en/mod/mod_dir.html#directoryindex
in example C?

If you first "disable" DirectoryIndex, you should then be able to set the ordering of your choice.
creator: christophe.jaillet@wanadoo.fr

> If you first "disable" DirectoryIndex, you should then be able to set the

I have not tried this, but this is also not a solution to the problem. We didn't want to change the package manager installed httpd.conf. If we did we might as well set the correct order right away.

The problem is that you're not allowed to overwrite it after it's been set. Most notably this also means that you cannot have a global default that can be overwritten for a specific vhost.
